channel.title: TCP Non-blocking I/O
channel.description:
Say I have a Java program that acts as a server to x # of clients, stored in an array. Each of these clients has an object of Socket associated with it. I want to be able to check to see if there is data written to the socket without blocking the entire program, and without using thread-per-client.
So, like, looping through an array of clients, calling a method like handleInput() which would check to see if there is new data from the client and then perform the appropriate actions. The problem I'm having is that I can't find any method that would check to see if there is new data without stopping the whole program until data is received. How would I do this without using thread-per-client?
Also, googling the problem did not help, either that or I'm really terrible at wording my search queries...

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

inputStream.available() is ok, but wont scale up, you’d have problems with more then 20 or so clients.
nio and selector is the best thing, iv heard of it handling 3000 clients at once, but might be slightly harder for you to use.

so its a balance of your skill with how many clients you’ll have
